channel.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
channel.description:
I have been searching all over the internet all day and cannot find an answer.
Moparscape is the only client I can get to work under Ubuntu, but even then the servers I CAN connect to are real buggy. Most servers out there require the use of their own clients I have found.
So my question is, what is the best server/client that you can get to work under linux?
(I'm assuming for it to work, the client's need to include a shell script?)

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

btw you can use jbe and change cache path without decompiling, etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“ZangetsuVampiro, post:23, topic:283594”]i have ubuntu and i’ve had ubutnu for over 7 months and sh file are nice to have are not needed in order to run or play a runescape private server on ubuntu. all you need in order to do it is java, wine, and a terminal code. once you have these things done you’ll be able to run and play the server just as if you was using windows.[/quote]cool

Read full topic

i have ubuntu and i’ve had ubutnu for over 7 months and sh file are nice to have are not needed in order to run or play a runescape private server on ubuntu. all you need in order to do it is java, wine, and a terminal code. once you have these things done you’ll be able to run and play the server just as if you was using windows.

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @andrew4444 andrew4444
item.description:
@andrew4444 wrote:

Some sources already come pre-packaged with the .sh files, all you need to do is chmod the files and have jdk, i’m currently moving my server from Windows XP professional to Opensuse, so once I succeed I may post a guide on the forums for reference.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“lotery33, post:18, topic:283594”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=374796.msg3127778#msg3127778 date=1266171556]

How do i run my server on linux? the client works, but not the server. I make a .sh file but it only opens me a notepadlike program with the script in it.

chmod +x file / use terminal

Why bump?
[/quote]

What the hell is tht supposed 2 mean?[/quote]
Are you retarded? l2linux/chmod.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:13, topic:283594”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=374796.msg2826694#msg2826694 date=1245069536]

Gah, I hate compiling using terminal…

I just use netbeans, and build, go to the folder directory, right click on the projectname.jar, and click ‘run with java…’

Best way for simple things.

javac MyClass.java
java MyClass

How hard is that?
[/quote]

Hard for people like fellixombc.[/quote]
Laziness is a issue.[quote=“Unhandled, post:14, topic:283594”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=374796.msg2826527#msg2826527 date=1245039751]
Gah, I hate compiling using terminal…

I just use netbeans, and build, go to the folder directory, right click on the projectname.jar, and click ‘run with java…’

Best way for simple things.
[/quote]
Pretty sure you can get netbeans to compile and debug, all with one button.[/quote]
Yeah I know.

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

eczema3:

Remember a lot of the faggots at moparscape assume that you have windows installed, so they set the cache directory to C:\windows.some_retarded_name32

Nothing you can do about that then.

[quote=“T4_, post:8, topic:283594”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=374796.msg2825984#msg2825984 date=1244994255]
You can probably change the script from moparscape to work with other clients easily enough.

Or you can wait until the new version of moparscape comes out, it will support custom caches, and multiple versions (currently 317 and 508)
[/quote]
I am guessing you’re still re-factoring the entire client?[/quote]

I’m still working on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux freindly runescape private server/client
item.dc:creator: @Tulitikku Tulitikku
item.description:
@Tulitikku wrote:

[quote=“Dankstah, post:5, topic:283594”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=374796.msg2825428#msg2825428 date=1244945291]

I realise Java is cross platform. I still cannot run any client but moparscape. It is probably possible to run a client that doesn’t contain the shell script (like the mac/linux download for moparscape) and I just lack the knowledge. Also, almost every single server requires the use of their client, and if I use mopar with it, I’ll either disconnect or everything will look bad.

Why the hell would you need a shell script when you have access to terminal directly?
[/quote]

… I don’t know man. I just know I used the .sh to run MoparScape.

I’m just having problems playing on private servers, as I can’t run any of their clients. Either that, or I just don’t know how. All of their files are .bat and I assume under windows you just run them.[/quote]In the terminal:

cd /path/of/client java Gui
At least on all the clients I’ve played on.

Read full topic

I’m just having problems playing on private servers, as I can’t run any of their clients. Either that, or I just don’t know how. All of their files are .bat and I assume under windows you just run them.
